meanings.definition: Show feelings of superiority; be patronizing.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the older kids would condescend to play with the younger ones.
meanings.sent2: She would often condescend to speak to the new students as if they were beneath her.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to condescend to acknowledge the presence of the tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: The queen would never condescend to mingle with the commoners.
meanings.sent5: His condescending tone made everyone feel small and insignificant.

meanings.definition: Do something in a haughty way, as though it is below one's dignity.
meanings.sent1: He would condescend to pick up the trash, but only with a look of disdain.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity would only condescend to sign autographs for a select few fans.
meanings.sent3: The princess would condescend to wear the old dress, but only for a costume party.
meanings.sent4: The rich man would never condescend to enter the store without his entourage.
meanings.sent5: Her condescending attitude made even simple tasks seem beneath her.

meanings.definition: Behave in a way that suggests one feels superior.
meanings.sent1: He would often condescend to give advice on topics he knew little about.
meanings.sent2: The professor would condescend to explain the basic concepts to the confused students.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to condescend to interact with the outdated technology.
meanings.sent4: The eagle condescended to soar above all other birds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: Her condescending behavior made it clear she thought she was better than everyone else.
